poem:
Unspoken Witness

The silence speaks, louder 
than thrush or brook,
a theatre of nature marred,
not by tooth and claw,
but by hands unseen.
Grayscale chuckles turn to red,
the forest sighs—no words,
only the cryptic roar
of loss and shadowed sorrow,
a script unwritten,
yet indelible.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
